newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal Telecom not seeking strategic partner. [CORRECTED 19:31 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Portugal Telecom not seeking strategic partner. [CORRECTED 19:31 GMT]

text.p: Portugal Telecom has given up the idea of seeking the "classic" global partner (corrects) as the route to future development, a spokeswoman said.
She told Reuters that this was the conclusion of its decision to seek a strategic alignment that might involve just the taking of a "symbolic" stake in the company.
"In this phase, the entry of a strategic partner has been put aside," the spokeswoman said.
"What would normally be called a strategic partner, that is somebody who would buy more than 20 percent...and have a significant say in the management, has been put aside," she said.
A small stake would be around five percent, she added.
Earlier, the company said that it would be looking for a "strategic alignment with a global alliance...in areas of specific interest for Portugal Telecom."
This alliance could result in the taking of a "symbolic interest" in Portugal Telecom.
